questions.question: What is MPI commonly used for in distributed systems?

answers.a: Managing a shared memory space among distributed nodes
answers.b: Enabling message-passing between processes on different nodes
answers.c: Controlling hardware directly on a single machine
answers.d: Providing a standard library for building graphical user interfaces

explanations.a: Incorrect. MPI does not manage shared memory but handles message-passing.
explanations.b: Correct. MPI is designed for message-passing between processes in distributed systems.
explanations.c: Incorrect. MPI operates on a higher level and doesn't control hardware directly.
explanations.d: Incorrect. MPI is unrelated to GUI development.

questions.question: Which MPI operation would you use to send data from one process to another specific process?

explanations.a: Incorrect. MPI_Bcast broadcasts data from one process to all other processes.
explanations.b: Incorrect. MPI_Reduce aggregates data across processes.
explanations.c: Correct. MPI_Send is used for sending data directly from one process to another.
explanations.d: Incorrect. MPI_Gather collects data from multiple processes.

questions.question: Which MPI operation would you use to broadcast a variable from one process to all other processes?

explanations.a: Incorrect. MPI_Send is for point-to-point communication, not broadcasting.
explanations.b: Incorrect. MPI_Recv is for receiving messages in point-to-point communication.
explanations.c: Correct. MPI_Bcast broadcasts data from one process to all others in a communicator.
explanations.d: Incorrect. MPI_Reduce aggregates values across processes, not broadcasting.

questions.question: In a distributed MPI program, how would you typically aggregate partial results from all nodes?

explanations.a: Incorrect. MPI_Bcast sends data from one process to all others.
explanations.b: Incorrect. MPI_Scatter distributes different parts of data to processes.
explanations.c: Correct. MPI_Reduce combines results from all processes.
explanations.d: Incorrect. MPI_Cart_create defines a communication topology.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using non-blocking operations like MPI_Isend and MPI_Irecv in MPI?

answers.a: They allow overlapping communication with computation
answers.c: They require fewer resources than blocking operations
answers.d: They improve error handling for distributed systems

explanations.a: Correct. Non-blocking operations enable computation to proceed while communication is pending.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Non-blocking operations do not perform synchronization.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Non-blocking operations can require careful resource management.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Non-blocking operations do not specifically enhance error handling.

questions.question: Why is domain decomposition important in distributed systems?

answers.a: It prevents nodes from communicating with each other
answers.b: It allows the problem to be split into parts processed independently
answers.c: It reduces the need for inter-process communication
answers.d: It ensures that all nodes have the same data

explanations.a: Incorrect. Domain decomposition involves communication between nodes.
explanations.b: Correct. Domain decomposition allows each process to handle a part of the problem.
explanations.c: Incorrect. While it may reduce communication, that is not its main purpose.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Nodes typically work on different parts of the problem, not identical data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common challenge in distributed systems for computing π?

answers.a: Ensuring all processes share a common memory space
answers.c: Storing the entire dataset on each node
answers.d: Avoiding any use of network resources

explanations.a: Incorrect. Distributed systems do not use shared memory across nodes.
explanations.b: Correct. Synchronization can be challenging in distributed systems.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Nodes usually handle parts of the data independently.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Communication over a network is essential in distributed systems.

questions.question: Which MPI function would be used to define a grid topology for processes?

explanations.a: Incorrect. MPI_Bcast broadcasts data to all processes.
explanations.b: Incorrect. MPI_Comm_rank retrieves the process rank.
explanations.c: Incorrect. MPI_Gather collects data from all processes.
explanations.d: Correct. MPI_Cart_create creates a process grid for communication.

questions.question: What is a benefit of using the Monte Carlo method to compute π in a distributed system?

answers.a: It requires no random numbers for approximation
answers.b: It provides an exact value of π
answers.c: It is easily parallelizable and can handle failures gracefully
answers.d: It is unaffected by the number of samples used

explanations.a: Incorrect. The Monte Carlo method uses random sampling.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The Monte Carlo method approximates π, not providing an exact value.
explanations.c: Correct. Monte Carlo is suitable for parallel computation and can adapt to node failure.
explanations.d: Incorrect. More samples generally improve the accuracy of the result.
